item.title: Australian broadcaster Clive James dies aged 80
item.description: The critic, author, poet and TV host was known for his witty commentary on international television.

item.title: Row over Labour's 'NHS for sale' claim
item.description: Jeremy Corbyn says his party has a 451-page dossier of evidence - but the Tories say he is lying.

item.title: General election 2019: SNP vote 'will send clear message on indyref2'
item.description: Nicola Sturgeon says her party wants to "escape Brexit and put Scotland's future in Scotland's hands".

item.title: Gary Rhodes: Chef and TV presenter dies aged 59
item.description: The celebrity chef and TV personality was known for his spiky hair and passion for British cuisine.

item.title: Jaden Moodie: Boy, 14, 'killed by rival gang in frenzied attack'
item.description: Jaden Moodie "did not stand a chance" as he was targeted by a group of five men, a court hears.

item.title: Open door on 80mph Southend train 'due to loose screws'
item.description: Operator Greater Anglia has since found a similar fault on 60 other doorways, a report says.

item.title: Couple fall victim to holiday scam
item.description: Simone and Alice Cardillo arrived at their accommodation to find it was empty and for sale.

item.title: Holey Artisan cafe: Bangladesh Islamists sentenced to death for 2016 attack
item.description: Seven Islamists are sentenced to death for an attack on a Bangladesh cafe that killed 22 people.

item.title: West Coast Mainline passengers 'stranded for seven hours'
item.description: Trains between Preston and Scotland will not run until Friday after lines were "majorly damaged".

item.title: Jonathan Miller, director and humorist, dies at 85
item.description: The theatre and opera director famously starred in the Beyond the Fringe comedy revue in the 1960s.

item.title: Justin Welby: 'I felt nervous about opening up about my mental healthâ€™
item.description: The Archbishop of Canterbury tells Emma Barnett about seeking help and challenging the stigma of mental health.

item.title: Black Friday: US couple charge shoppers to queue
item.description: A US couple are trying to make money out of sitting in Black Friday queues for shoppers.

item.title: Gary Rhodes' life in pictures: Michelin stars, MasterChef and more
item.description: Look back at the life of the celebrity chef who enjoyed huge popularity in the kitchen and on TV.

item.title: Pushy pig steals spotlight during live TV broadcast
item.description: Presenters at a Greek TV station cry with laughter as the nosey intruder take centre stage.

item.title: Stafford man's weary World War Two teddy bear up for auction
item.description: The bear sat on Tom Matthews' father's lap during a victory parade in Berlin in 1945.

item.title: James Gellatly: Scooter champion, 12, shows off his tricks
item.description: James Gellatly became a junior world champion in the extreme sport earlier this year.

item.title: How much! Why are service station snacks so expensive?
item.description: A bottle of water costs four times more on the motorway than in a supermarket, mystery shoppers say.

item.title: TRNSMT: Gender-balanced festival line-ups 'several years' away
item.description: TRNSMT boss says that more women need to be "picking up guitars" to address festival gender balance.

item.title: The YouTuber with 26 billion views
item.description: Brazil's Konrad Dantas, better know as Kondzilla, has the world's second most watched music video channel.

item.title: Russian cows get VR headsets 'to reduce anxiety'
item.description: The herd was shown "a unique summer field simulation program" in a bid to boost milk yields.

item.title: Newspaper headlines: Corbyn 'horror show' and 'Â£105m win nearly killed me'
item.description: Most of Wednesday's papers splash on the Labour leader's interview with the BBC's Andrew Neil.

item.title: CEO Secrets: 'My success is all down to maths'
item.description: Timothy Armoo of Fanbytes explains how his success is grounded in a love of maths.

item.title: 'My drink was spiked on my second day at university'
item.description: Fresher Lily Petch has told BBC Radio 5 Live what happened when she collapsed in the street.

item.title: How a cake company pioneered the first office computer
item.description: How the Lyons catering company pioneered LEO, the first electronic office system

item.title: Clive James obituary: 'A man of substance'
item.description: The writer, film-maker and broadcaster brought his acute gaze to the whole range of human activity.

item.title: Beauty industry bullying: 'I saw strong women cry at their desks'
item.description: An independent body is needed to investigate claims of bullying in the beauty industry, a trade organisation says.

item.title: The real story behind Prince's Little Red Corvette
item.description: Legend has it Prince wrote the song after falling asleep in a bandmate's car. That's not 100% true.

item.title: Can you charge different customers different amounts?
item.description: Is it possible to make some clients pay a premium for goods and sell them cheaply to a mass market?

item.title: Kamala Harris school plan: The two hours costing US parents thousands
item.description: A proposal to keep US schools open longer has led to a polarised debate over childcare nationwide.

item.title: Von der Leyen's Commission: The ones to watch at Europeâ€™s new top table
item.description: The EU parliament approves incoming Commission President Ursula von der Leyen's new team.

item.title: India's toilets: Report questions claims that rural areas are free from open defecation
item.description: India's prime minister has said defecating in the open has ended in rural India - but is that true?

item.title: Tiger Woods: His scandalous, tumultuous and redemptive decade, sparked by a car crash
item.description: In the early hours of 27 November, 2009, Tiger Woods crashed his car outside his Florida home. It began a scandalous, tumultuous and redemptive decade.

item.title: Iran protests: Videos reveal crackdown regime tried to hide from world
item.description: Social media is painting a picture of a government crackdown bloodier than many had feared.

item.title: Why France is focused on fighting jihadists in Mali
item.description: As Islamist militant violence escalates France wants the the rest of Europe to join the deadly fight.

item.title: Nuno possible replacement if Arsenal sack Emery
item.description: Arsenal identify Wolves boss Nuno Espirito Santo as a potential replacement for Unai Emery if the Gunners decide to sack the Spaniard.

item.title: 'Moreno was disloyal' - Spain coach Enrique criticises predecessor
item.description: Spain's returning manager Luis Enrique says his predecessor Robert Moreno was "disloyal" and will not be part of his coaching team.

item.title: Dillian Whyte to face Mariusz Wach on Joshua-Ruiz undercard in Saudi Arabia
item.description: Dillian Whyte will face Poland's Mariusz Wach on the undercard of Anthony Joshua's world-title bout with Andy Ruiz Jr in Saudi Arabia.

item.title: 'Goooooaaaaal!' - keeper scores from inside his own box
item.description: Chivas Guadalajara goalkeeper Antonio Rodriguez scores a goal from inside his own box during his side's 3-1 win against Veracruz in Mexico's Liga MX.

item.title: Jenson Button on failing his first driving test & owning two yachts
item.description: Jenson Button - the 2009 Formula One world champion - talks about failing his first driving test and his childhood love for Mario Kart as he busts internet rumours in BBC Sport's Setting it Straight.

item.title: SNP manifesto 2019: Key policies explained
item.description: The SNP election manifesto has been launched. What are its most eye-catching promises?

item.title: General election 2019: Jeremy Corbyn interview fact-checked
item.description: Reality Check looks at claims made by the Labour leader in a special interview with the BBC's Andrew Neil.

item.title: Who should I vote for? General election 2019 policy guide
item.description: Compare where the parties stand on key issues, from Brexit and the NHS to education and the environment.

item.title: Election explained: What to look out for on climate change and the environment
item.description: If you care about what the parties are promising to do about the environment, here are some key issues to watch for.

item.title: General election 2019: The big names facing a nervy election night
item.description: A look at the well-known MPs who are in danger of losing their seats on 12 December.

item.title: General Election 2019: The Facebook influencers you've never heard of
item.description: Far from newspaper offices and TV studios, committed volunteer activists have created an alternative Facebook media universe.

item.title: Election 2019: Islamophobia? Anti-Semitism? What happened on Tuesday
item.description: The BBC's Nick Eardley breaks down the main events of Tuesday's election campaigning.

item.title: The bar helping homeless people register to vote
item.description: Staff in a Bristol bar are helping people with no permanent address register to vote.

item.title: Ashfield candidate faces criticism over 'fake door knock'
item.description: Lee Anderson was seemingly caught on a TV microphone arranging to call at a supporter's house.

item.title: General election 2019: Nicola Sturgeon interview fact-checked
item.description: Reality Check looks at claims made by the SNP leader in a special interview with the BBC's Andrew Neil.

item.title: General election 2019: 'No solo Labour canvassing' in Bromyard after attack
item.description: The party says it will work in pairs in Bromyard following an assault on a volunteer in her 70s.

item.title: General election 2019: Brexit Party MEP and Rizzle Kicks have dinner
item.description: What happens when two people from across the political divide are brought together for dinner?

item.title: Election 2019, Your Questions Answered: What's being done for the self-employed?
item.description: Your questions answered on tax, finance and MPs' employment details.

item.title: Sir John Curtice: Why age, not class, matters most
item.description: Fifty years ago, people voted in the UK largely according to class, but different factors are now in play.

item.title: General election 2019: What to look out for on crime
item.description: If you care about what the parties are promising to do about crime, here are some key issues to watch for.

item.title: BBC acknowledges 'mistake' in Boris Johnson editing
item.description: The BBC says editing footage of Prime Minister Boris Johnson for a news bulletin was "a mistake".

item.title: General election 2019: What is Labour offering to Waspi women?
item.description: Reality Check looks at the compensation being offered by Labour to women born in the 1950s.

item.title: General election 2019: Can the NHS boost nurse numbers by 50,000?
item.description: The Conservative manifesto pledges a big increase in nurse numbers in England - is it realistic?

item.title: Conservative Party manifesto 2019: 13 key policies explained
item.description: The Conservative Party election manifesto has been launched. What are its most eye-catching promises?

item.title: General election poll tracker: How do the parties compare?
item.description: Our poll tracker measures how people say they are going to vote at the next general election.

item.title: General election 2019: The towns and cities least likely to vote
item.description: City dwellers tend to vote differently to the rest of the country and this divide is deepening.

item.title: General election 2019: What are rent controls?
item.description: A simple look at how rent controls work and how effective they are.

item.title: The Tory manifesto in (just over) two minutes
item.description: Political correspondent Helen Catt outlines the main bits of the newly-launched Conservative manifesto.

item.title: Election 2019, Your Questions Answered: Are there record numbers of NHS staff?
item.description: Your questions answered on mental health, social care and the future funding of the NHS.

item.title: General election 2019: The candidates standing in each constituency
item.description: The BBC News site is listing all candidates standing on 12 December - find them with our postcode search.

item.title: This Matters: Will how you vote make you better off?
item.description: How is this election going to hit you in the pocket?

item.title: General election 2019: A really simple guide
item.description: The UK's main parties are gearing up for a general election on 12 December.

item.title: Teal Swan: The woman encouraging her followers to visualise death
item.description: The BBC has heard testimony that the teachings of spiritual influencer Teal Swan may have contributed to the suicides of at least two of her followers.

item.title: The fight to get citizenship for descendants of German Jews
item.description: A UK lawyer says Germany is violating its constitution by denying citizenship to some descendants of Nazi victims.

item.title: Cryptoqueen: How this woman scammed the world, then vanished
item.description: How did Ruja Ignatova make $4bn selling her fake cryptocurrency to the world - and where did she go?

item.title: Russian domestic violence: Women fight back
item.description: Two years ago Russia passed a law reducing sentences for domestic violence. There is now a movement pushing back.
